info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 19 at 2:02PM MST until February 20 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 11 AM MST MONDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY EVENING THROUGH LATE TUESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 7 inches but a trace to 2 inches for Deer Lodge and Butte. Winds gusting 20 to 30 mph, reaching 50+ mph at MacDonald Pass. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches possible along and north of Highway 12, including over MacDonald Pass. 3 to 5 inches along the I90 corridor between Drummond and Homestake Pass. Blowing and drifting snow as winds gust to 40 mph, dangerously cold wind chills and a freeze up on roadways is possible Tuesday evening with an arctic front passage. * WHERE...Butte, Georgetown Lake, Highway 12 Garrison to Elliston, Homestake Pass, and MacDonald Pass. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 5 PM this afternoon to 11 AM MST Monday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Monday evening through late Tuesday night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The cold wind chills as low as 30 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
